issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Related task is top 10 for 4.0.1, this one is a partner issue to that and should also be fixed for 4.0.1. 

Disable action buttons (save changes, add tag, add rule, add user, Next in wizards etc) button until all required fields have values selected, or when there are no changes entered. Enable button only when there are changes, or all required fields have values. For example, in wizards, the Next button should be disabled until all required fields have values. 

Also, if there are values entered in a rule or user or tag and the user hasn't clicked the add button for that thing, we should pop up a similar modal box to the one implemented as part of GUI-795 when the Next or Create or Launch button is clicked, so that the user knows they need to click add rule|user|tag prior to creating the resource.
fields.summary: Add disable/unable button and unsaved tag wanrning modal to the pages and wizard for creating resources

comments.body:
For the instance launch wizard and launch configuration wizard, we should definitely disable the "Next" button until all the required fields' values have been provided.

However, for the resource create pages, such as the create volume and create security group, those pages are protected by Foundation's validation mechanism such that clicking on the "Create" button would trigger the validation error on the page. 

So, the question is, do we still want to disable the "Create" buttons for these pages? 

See the attachment.
hi [~kyolee], Yes, I think we do. Enablement is really the primary cue, and validation errors are secondary.

A new branch is created for this ticket, which came from the previous GUI-795-fix branch:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/765

Created the pull request above for UX review.

[~kyolee] if you have work done on this ticket, why is it not In Progress in Jira? Can you please move it to In Progress if you are working on it? Thanks!

Or to In Review if you are ready for review...thanks!

Works great for create security group button, nice job [~kyolee]!

Can you do the same magic for add rule and add tag, so that hose buttons are disabled until values are present, please?

Pull request has been created for UX review at:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/772

All create resource pages now have the disable/enable button feature implemented.
no review done yet. kicking back to [~kyolee] for additional implementation of modal boxes when next or create button is clicked and there are un-added tags or rules or users.

Pull request at:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/782

In this branch, the fixes include,

  - for all create resource pages,
     -- Disable the Create or Next button if required input fields aren't filled.
     -- Display the warning modal if a tag or a rule is not saved.

Excellent work, [~kyolee]! Almost there!

* on the create security group page, I filled out the rule and tag stuff and did not add either one. It is fine the way you handled the messaging, only display the add rule message first, but when I dismissed the modal box, things went haywire, and it looks like a modal wants to display but none is displaying. I've attached a screenshot. 
* allocate IPs does not have anything by default in the entry field but the allocate button was still enabled. Can you work your magic on that screen too, please?  
* create users needs the magic done on the add user button just like add tag and add rule. I added one user and then typed in a second one and the create button was enabled and I didn't get a warning modal about the second user typed in but not added. 
* Also I still see that button blinking gray at me, it doesn't stay that way but it's still not quite correct behavior, it shouldn't flash gray at all once enabled.

[~jloza] Verified the security group create page's issue. Will investigate the issue. Allocated IPs and Create Users work will be added.

For the user page's button blinking issue is being tracked on the ticket GUI-1053. This work is currently waiting for the merge of this branch in order to avoid having resolving merge conflict on the user page.

Fixes above have been added.

Pull request at:

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/782

Hi [~kyolee], everything looks GREAT in your feature branch. AWESOME JOB!

I updated the text for the create users unsaved user message a tad, and added that to your PR. Travis is currently running on that. Once it passes, I am hesitant to merge the branch because it looks like there are a couple of earlier commits that are causing problems (they have red x by them)?

Can you check those out and clear any conflicts and then go ahead and merge the branch? Let me know when you've done that, please.
[~jloza] There was an issue with Selenium test with the change made in the allocate IPs dialog. Submitted a fix for it, and will merge the branch once the automated test passes.
[~kgill] OK'ed UX review by [~jloza], and fixed the selenium issue and verified it passing on the Jenkins build. Once the code review is done, please feel free to merge. Thank you!
